subject: Art & Design
title: Gutenberg and the Printing Revolution
description: A short lesson to help you apply Gutenberg and the Printing Revolution.

hook.text: Before 1440, every book in Europe was copied by hand. One monk, one book, months of work.

buildup.text: Gutenberg combined movable metal type with a wine press. The printing press was born.

discovery.text: His first major print â€” the Gutenberg Bible â€” used blackletter type mimicking handwritten manuscripts.

twist.text: Gutenberg went bankrupt. His investor seized the press and made the fortune instead.

climax.text: Within 50 years, 20 million books were printed in Europe. Literacy, science, and revolution followed.

punchline.text: One press. Twenty million books. The world was never the same.

quiz.question: What was revolutionary about Gutenberg's invention?
options: Movable metal type enabled mass production of books
